column3: Eilis would call you to the wall once more.
Eilis has briefed you on the need to divert Sahagin forces away from South Tidegate. Speak with Nortmoen about the tactical situation.
Nortmoen outlines a simple plan: slay a pair of trenchtooth Sahagin.
Apprise Eilis of the situation in the north.
Eilis reports that the decoy attack was a success, and that the detachment returned safely through the southern gates without ado.
We would open South Tidegate to welcome a returning detachment, but doing so would expose us to the Sahagin.
Thus, we aim to launch a diversionary attack along the north side and lure the Sahagin hordes away from the open gate.
Seek out Nortmoen at North Tidegate─the offensive falls under his command.

So you've come to help bail my beleaguered brother out from under trouble's foot once more? Very well. All you need do is slay a pair of the skittish little sea slugs─that ought to summon the lot of them.
Sure as rain, our subtle stratagem drew the southerly sea-sods away from the open gates. The men of the detachment send their gratitude.
